data.title: friendly lunch spot where they'll be happy to see you (and feed you)
data.text: This lunch spot is right downtown. They have excellent homemade soups and delicious Phillies. We've visited several times since moving here. Customers are greeted warmly and the vibe is always fun.

data.title: A must try if you are ever in Saint Cloud!
data.text: This place is amazing in every way. From customer service to  consistent quality of food to the feel of the place it's all just amazing.  I have been here a multiple times and the owners go above and beyond for their customers. There was a time that I went that there was a confusion with my order when it was taken. Not a big deal at all to me and I expressed that as I understand that mistakes happen. They gave me one of the most delicious cupcakes I have ever had as a 'we are sorry'. I had never had that happen before, and the place was packed! They are genuine and friendly when you arrive in the restaurant and they have a great specials every day. We have had the specials on several occasions and they are amazing. My favorites on their regular menu are their Russian hotdog or sandwiches (the actual names arw escaping me right now) you can't go wrong with either of them. Also try every single one of their deserts they are all good. Like better than the places I've been that specialize in making cupcakes. They also offer vinegar for your dolsies (their version of fries) which I haven't seen in a long time. Just delicious. If I didn't live so far away and could afford it, I would be there everyday. One thing to keep in mind is that they do close early compared to other restaurants. I tend to forget the 3 pm closing time.

data.title: You'll crave it
data.text: I've been coming to Dolsie's for about 2 years now and it is the most amazing little restaurant in downtown St. Cloud. If you have the chance to stop by and grab a bite please do. The service is wonderful and you'll feel part of the family. You'll never leave without a smile on your face or an empty stomach.

data.title: Favorite lunch in Saint Cloud
data.text: Dolsies has a very welcoming and friendly atmosphere! The food is always made fresh to order. My favorite item to get is the philly with delicious au jus, with a side of their olies which are crinkle cut cottage fries. The cupcakes are pretty great too, with filling in each one. I would definitely recommend stopping by for a visit!

data.title: A Wonderful Experience
data.text: We had a party of 10 that had heard about this restaurant and decided to have our lunch there.  We walked in and they were able to seat us shortly on a communal table where we could all visit.  The food came out quickly and was served to us by the owners.  We all ordered different items and they were all delicious.  I had the Shaved Rib Eye Sandwich which I understand is one of their most popular items.  They have a huge variety off items to choose from and again, I cannot say enough about how friendly they were to us.  A definite must stop if you're ever in St. Cloud!!!

data.title: Yum!
data.text: Friendly service and large portions of delicious food.  We could have shared the cheese steak sandwich with onion rings.  We are visiting from out of town,  but if we get the chance to return,  we'll definitely stop here again!

data.title: Great food,  great service!
data.text: Fast, friendly service,  great tasting food and plenty of it! Highly recommend Dolsie's Lunch Box Grille!

data.title: An Enjoyable Lunch
data.text: My husband and I returned to St. Cloud to attend a wedding, after having lived there for 27 years.  We needed an early lunch and discovered Dolsie' s within walking distance of our downtown hotel.  What a welcome addition to the city.  He had the club sandwich which was made better than most because of the homemade bread.  I had the fish and chips but the chips were ollies, a round potato, some crispy, others a softer potato but all delicious!  The owner visited with us and shared he and his wife own and run it.  He does most of the cooking and she does the baking.  We would strongly recommend Dolsie' s for lunch or an early dinner.  We will surely return the next time we are in town.

data.title: Why Would You Eat Lunch Anywhere Else in St. Cloud?
data.text: I followed a lead from Trip Advisor and hit this place for lunch. OMG!! How good was it? I went back the next day to sample yet another delight on the menu. My favorite was some thinly sliced beef sandwich that I still wish I could recreate here at home. Not being a pastrami lover, I tried one of their hamburgers -  excellent. Just don't pass up the fries like I did!! Cupcakes were great, atmosphere welcoming - what more can I say, except Why would you eat lunch anywhere else in St. Cloud???

data.title: A little family place
data.text:
Go here  frequently.  Always good food.   The Philly is my husbands favorite. And the Strami is also top notch.
They make their own sub bread and popovers.  The bread is so light, almost melts in your mouth.  Have not tried the desserts, but I'm sure they do not disappoint.  The owners are always there, which is really nice because they get to know their customers and always greet you with a big smile.  I would definitely recommend Dolsies.

data.title: Delightful and Deliciouis! And great value!
data.text: My 2 daughters and I stopped by for lunch on Saturday and wow were we happy,  First of all the upbeat owners are so welcoming and kind, then we order ...I had soup, one daughter had a tuna sandwich and the other a burger  We added a couple of popovers in for good measure.  The food was SOOO GOOOD!!  And we ended up taking about half of it home because of the generous portions.  We look forward to going back!!!  The cupcakes looked amazing so it wont be long before we head in to snatch a few of those!!  Thanks guys for REALLY good food and being so friendly!!

data.title: Good Service Good Food.
data.text: Stopped in for a burger, Was very good. Happy atmosphere and a clean looking setup. Very fresh food.

data.title: Our favorite restaurant for lunch in St. Cloud!
data.text: Great little restaurant!  We've been going here for about a year. The food is always homemade and FRESH, FRESH, FRESH!  From gyros, to wraps, walleye sandwiches, soups or salads we've never been disappointed!  They are open M-Sat from about 10am - 2pm. Prices are very reasonable. The owners are so friendly!  Our favorite item on the menu is the Chicken Ceasar Wrap. Don't miss their Little Olies or homemade sweets. Yum!

data.title: My favorite place for lunch downtown
data.text: The food is really good and the workers are very friendly. It's always busy. The food  selection is broad.  It's not expensive. I like the atmosphere right near the Paramont theater

data.title: Quick service
data.text: Reminded me a bit of a New Jersey diner with the handful of Greek items on the menu.  Food was ok.  I think the gyros came from a package.  Homemade popover was delicious, but a strange accompaniment for a Greek salad.

data.title: Fantastic Food and Service
data.text: I love coming here.  My family and I relocated to the area and I am something of a foodie so I like to check out the options.  Upon reviewing Tripadvisor I cam across this location and tried it out with my wife.  All I can say is the food was amazing.  Best Phili Cheese Steak West of Phili.   They actually know what Cheese Whiz is so I was beyond happy.  Their Fries are a little different but the batter is light and tasty and I would highly recommend the Chili Cheese topping if you order them.   The owner and his wife are just amazing.  Great people, clean restaurant, good atmosphere.  I have started bringing others from my office to the restaurant and they love it as well.  Just remember they they are only open for lunch.

data.title: Best and only stramis in town
data.text: Iv been going here little over a year and i love every vist, foods good, great atmosphere, lovly couple runing the place. Most people agree that pual and pam are the best. And dont get me started on pams baking

data.title: Friendly People, Decent Food
data.text: Dolsie's offers a nice lunch selection of sandwiches and the like. It's always hopping for lunch. The proprietors are friendly, and service is usually pretty fast. You won't be disappointed.

data.title: Delicious food at a great price and very friendly service!
data.text: We have been hooked since we ate here a year ago.  Great daily specials that are made to order and plentiful!  The soup is always incredibly delicious!  Wonderful seasonal desserts and we are always greeted with a friendly smile and conversation from the owners!  Wonderful place for a quick business lunch or a great place to meet friends or family.

data.title: Spicy and Pricey
data.text: I decided to try Dolsie's because I was able to purchase a savings certificate from a favorite radio station, and because I wanted to support business which supported the radio station in turn. I met a friend there last week. I was glad I had the certificate, because the prices were higher than anticipated. I had no idea what to expect when I walked in the door. In my mind I had pictured a long counter with tables on the sides, like an old fashioned soda fountain. I also thought that since they called themselves a lunch box, perhaps the food would come in brown paper bags. Instead I found a relatively small counter, about six booths, and some small tables. We had to order our food at the counter, and then they brought it out. I had the Boneless Buffalo Chicken Wrap with grilled chicken. It was $8.49 without any chips, fries or beverage. I thought that was a bit steep. It did taste good, however. It was spicy, and also messy.   The décor was modern, but the entryway had a cozy, antique feel with old books on bookshelves. They close by 2:30, so it is not a spot to eat and then linger over coffee with a friend. It was quite busy over the lunch hour.
